column4: funkyhat: I did that, and it took me to the flash site & there are 3 file formats to d/load! I was told to look for .DEB files 'n there aren't any!! :(
Why not just install it with Synaptic? "flashplugin-nonfree" is in the repos.
Thanks, I tried synaptic but it didn't pick up anything I typed! Will look for "flashplugin-nonfree" Thanks *mwah*
You have to make sure all of your repositories are enabled in the "Software Sources"...
You say that like u think I know wot i'm doing!! lol
How do I do that, plse? :)
OK, if you are all ready in Synaptic, just go to the menu "Settings" and choose "Repositories"
everything under "ubuntu software" is ticked, do I need to go under the other headings 'n tick stuff too? :)
You should be OK I think, close it, go back to Synaptic, and hit the "Reload" button...
Blonde moment, I'm looking at synaptic on this pc which is FINE not the laptop!!! :(
Well I don't have any problems now you've armed me with sudo xkill! :)
So I had 2 just come 'n say Hi! I understand you're working, honey, so I won't keep you! lol
I'm gonna get a coffee, want one?
Sorry hon, I changed my mind 'n nicked the last cold bottle of Becks beer! :D
